scenario: An elite university admission committee navigates complex deliberations influenced by private donors, undisclosed enrollment targets, and confidential applicant background details. Each member must balance institutional integrity with donor expectations while ensuring fairness in applicant evaluations.
task: Develop a comprehensive admissions strategy that aligns committee decisions with donor preferences, enrollment goals, and ethical standards. Agents must negotiate the balance between academic integrity and donor influence while managing sensitive information to achieve consensus on candidate selections and enrollment targets.

agents.name: Admissions Director
agents.role: Leads the admissions committee, ensuring compliance with university policies while managing donor relations.
responsibilities: Set admission criteria based on university values.
Manage communication with donors regarding candidate preferences.
Ensure transparency in the selection process.

success_criteria.Candidate Selection Agreement: All committee members reach consensus on a final list of admitted candidates that balances donor influence and academic integrity.
success_criteria.Enrollment Target Alignment: Agreement on the number of students admitted aligns with the undisclosed enrollment target without compromising the selection process.
success_criteria.Transparency in Process: The committee agrees on a communication strategy that keeps donor expectations clear while maintaining confidentiality around applicant details.

deliverable: A comprehensive admissions strategy document outlining selected candidates, alignment with donor expectations, and adherence to enrollment targets.

public: Final admissions list published by May 1
private: Enrollment target must not exceed 150 students
No candidate must be admitted solely based on donor influence
All committee discussions must remain confidential

penalties_utilities: Penalties are expressed as utility losses (e.g., -200, -150, -100). Utilities are expressed as gains (e.g., +100, +75, +60).
Consensus_w: Consensus on candidate selections is required to balance donor influence and academic integrity.
